title: [Large-Scale] Pediatric Bladder Health Educator Competency Enhancement Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic urological knowledge and experience in pediatric health management
context.additional_context: Customized training design for corporate practitioners considering smartphone-based learning environments

learning_goals: Cultivate the ability to establish personalized behavior modification strategies for pediatric patients through self-voiding diary creation and analysis.

Learners analyze 3 customer interaction scenarios (complaint resolution, urgent requests, complex inquiries) applying situated learning theory. They design a draft training module (10 pages) meeting ≥4 of 5 checklist criteria (contextual relevance, learning objective clarity, interaction design, practicality, feedback system) within 3 days.
Strengthen competency in creating motivation-driven online educational content using ARCS model elements.

Learners develop ≥3 customized monitoring metrics (e.g., weekly check-in frequency, feedback implementation rate) for sustaining behavioral changes in parent-child collaboration systems. They propose improvements based on a 2-week pilot test.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
